title: C00-2123

sentences.text: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- .

Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm .
A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented .
The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel search procedure for statistical machine translation utilizing dynamic programming techniques, specifically addressing word reordering for efficient translation from German to English.

Entity-verbmobil_task.label: Verbmobil task
Entity-verbmobil_task.description: The Verbmobil task is a research initiative focused on limited-domain spoken language processing, specifically involving the translation and interpretation of spoken dialogue between German and English.

Entity-search_restriction.label: search restriction
Entity-search_restriction.description: The term 'search restriction' refers to a technique that limits the possible word reordering in statistical machine translation, specifically designed to enhance the efficiency of the translation process from German to English.

Entity-novel_technique_to_restrict_the_p.label: novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering
aliases: novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering
Entity-novel_technique_to_restrict_the_p.description: A novel technique designed to limit the reordering of words in statistical machine translation, enhancing the efficiency of the search algorithm, particularly for translating from German to English.

mentions.local_name: novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering

Entity-the_verbmobil_task.label: the Verbmobil task
Entity-the_verbmobil_task.description: The Verbmobil task refers to a limited-domain spoken-language task focused on German-English translation, utilizing an 8000-word vocabulary.

Entity-verbmobil.label: Verbmobil
Entity-verbmobil.description: Verbmobil is a research project focused on developing a limited-domain spoken-language translation system, specifically for German and English.

Entity-dp-based_solution.label: DP-based solution
Entity-dp-based_solution.description: The DP-based solution refers to an algorithm derived from dynamic programming techniques applied to the traveling salesman problem, which is utilized in the context of developing an efficient search procedure for statistical machine translation.

Entity-search_procedure.label: search procedure
Entity-search_procedure.description: The 'search procedure' refers to a method for statistical machine translation that utilizes dynamic programming to efficiently manage word reordering between source and target languages.

Entity-the_experimental_test.label: The experimental tests
Entity-the_experimental_test.description: The experimental tests refer to the evaluations conducted on the Verbmobil task, which involves translating spoken language from German to English using a limited vocabulary of 8000 words.

Entity-8000-word_vocabulary.label: 8000-word vocabulary
Entity-8000-word_vocabulary.description: The '8000-word vocabulary' refers to the specific set of words used in the Verbmobil task, which is a limited-domain spoken-language task focused on German to English translation.

Entity-dp.label: DP
Entity-dp.description: DP refers to dynamic programming, an algorithmic approach used in the paper to develop a search procedure for statistical machine translation.

Entity-word_reordering_between_source_an.label: word reordering between source and target language
aliases: word reordering between source and target language
Entity-word_reordering_between_source_an.description: Word reordering between source and target language refers to the systematic rearrangement of words during the translation process to accommodate the syntactic and semantic differences between the source language and the target language, thereby enhancing the efficiency of statistical machine translation algorithms.

mentions.local_name: word reordering between source and target language

Entity-dp-based_solution_to_the_travelin.label: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem
aliases: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem
Entity-dp-based_solution_to_the_travelin.description: A DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem refers to an algorithmic approach that utilizes dynamic programming techniques to efficiently solve the traveling salesman problem, which involves finding the shortest possible route that visits a set of cities and returns to the origin city.

mentions.local_name: DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem

Entity-search_procedure_for_statistical_.label: search procedure for statistical machine translation
aliases: search procedure for statistical machine translation
Entity-search_procedure_for_statistical_.description: A search procedure for statistical machine translation is a systematic method used to find the best translation output from a statistical model by evaluating possible translation candidates based on certain criteria.

mentions.local_name: search procedure for statistical machine translation

Entity-efficient_search_algorithm.label: efficient search algorithm
Entity-efficient_search_algorithm.description: An efficient search algorithm refers to a computational method designed to optimize the process of finding solutions in statistical machine translation by employing dynamic programming techniques to limit word reordering between source and target languages.

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to 'machine translation', specifically a statistical approach to translating languages using dynamic programming techniques.

Entity-novel_technique.label: novel technique
Entity-novel_technique.description: The 'novel technique' refers to a method for restricting word reordering between source and target languages in statistical machine translation, aimed at improving the efficiency of the search algorithm.

Entity-statistical_machine_translation.label: statistical machine translation
Entity-statistical_machine_translation.description: Statistical machine translation is a method of translating text from one language to another using statistical models that analyze and predict the likelihood of word sequences based on large corpora of bilingual text.

Entity-limited-domain_spoken-language_ta.label: limited-domain spoken-language task
Entity-limited-domain_spoken-language_ta.description: A limited-domain spoken-language task is a specific type of language processing task that focuses on a restricted set of topics or vocabulary, typically designed for applications such as speech recognition or dialogue systems.

Entity-word_reordering.label: word reordering
Entity-word_reordering.description: Word reordering is a linguistic process that involves rearranging the sequence of words in a sentence to improve clarity, coherence, or to meet the syntactic and semantic requirements of a target language during translation or language processing.

Entity-german.label: German
Entity-german.description: German refers to the German language, which is the source language in the context of statistical machine translation to English.

Entity-traveling_salesman_problem.label: traveling salesman problem
Entity-traveling_salesman_problem.description: The traveling salesman problem is a classic optimization problem in combinatorial mathematics that seeks to determine the shortest possible route for a salesman to visit a set of cities and return to the origin city, visiting each city exactly once.

Entity-translation_direction_from_german.label: translation direction from German to English
aliases: translation direction from German to English
the translation direction from German to English
Entity-translation_direction_from_german.description: The translation direction from German to English refers to the process or method of converting text or speech from the German language into the English language.

mentions.local_name: translation direction from German to English
the translation direction from German to English

Entity-german-english.label: German-English
Entity-german-english.description: German-English refers to the language pair used for translation between the German and English languages.

Entity-search_algorithm.label: search algorithm
Entity-search_algorithm.description: A search algorithm is a computational method used to retrieve information or find solutions by exploring a set of possible options or paths based on defined criteria.

Entity-translation_direction.label: translation direction
Entity-translation_direction.description: Translation direction refers to the specific pathway or orientation in which a text is translated from one language to another, indicating the source and target languages involved in the translation process.

Entity-dynamic_programming.label: dynamic programming
Entity-dynamic_programming.description: Dynamic programming is a computational method used for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems, which can be solved independently and combined to find the overall solution.

Entity-target_language.label: target language
Entity-target_language.description: A target language is the specific language into which text or speech is translated or adapted from a source language.

Entity-english.label: English
Entity-english.description: English is a West Germanic language that is primarily spoken in England and is widely used as a global lingua franca.

Entity-experimental_test.label: experimental tests
Entity-experimental_test.description: Experimental tests are systematic procedures conducted to evaluate hypotheses or assess the performance of a system or process under controlled conditions.

summary: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- . Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm . A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented . The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates that the subject provides an explanation, account, or detailed information about the object, which can be a concept, process, or entity. It establishes a relationship where the subject conveys knowledge or insights regarding the characteristics, functions, or significance of the object.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates that the subject is founded upon, derived from, or relies upon the object as a fundamental principle, method, or concept. It establishes a relationship where the object serves as a foundational element that informs, supports, or influences the subject's structure, function, or operation.

Predicate-restricts.label: restricts
Predicate-restricts.description: The predicate 'restricts' indicates a limiting or constraining relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject imposes certain boundaries or conditions that prevent the object from occurring freely or in its entirety. This implies that the subject has the power or authority to control the extent or manner in which the object can manifest or be utilized.

Predicate-achieves.label: achieves
Predicate-achieves.description: The predicate 'achieves' indicates a successful outcome or result that is obtained through the application or implementation of the subject. It connects the subject, which represents a method, process, or initiative, to the object, which signifies the goal, result, or product that is realized as a consequence of the subject's effectiveness.

Predicate-is_a_solution_to.label: is a solution to
Predicate-is_a_solution_to.description: The predicate 'is a solution to' establishes a relationship between a subject, which represents a method, approach, or technique, and an object, which denotes a problem, challenge, or question. This relationship indicates that the subject effectively addresses, resolves, or provides an answer to the object, thereby demonstrating its applicability or effectiveness in the context of the specified issue.

Predicate-is_useful_for.label: is useful for
Predicate-is_useful_for.description: The predicate 'is useful for' establishes a relationship where the subject provides a benefit or advantage in achieving a specific purpose or goal represented by the object. It indicates that the subject contributes positively to the effectiveness or efficiency of the action or process described by the object.

Predicate-are_carried_out_on.label: are carried out on
Predicate-are_carried_out_on.description: The predicate 'are carried out on' indicates that the subject performs or executes a specific action, process, or activity that is directed towards or focused on the object. It implies a relationship where the subject is actively engaging with the object in a manner that involves investigation, experimentation, or application, often to achieve a particular goal or to gather information.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject can be classified or defined in terms of the object, suggesting that they share a specific relationship or characteristic. In this context, 'is' functions to assert that the subject embodies the qualities or attributes represented by the object.

Predicate-is_a_task_of.label: is a task of
Predicate-is_a_task_of.description: The predicate 'is a task of' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a specific task or activity, and the object denotes the domain, language pair, or context in which that task is relevant or applicable. It indicates that the subject is an instance or example of a broader category of tasks associated with the object.

Predicate-has_a_vocabulary_of.label: has a vocabulary of
Predicate-has_a_vocabulary_of.description: The predicate 'has a vocabulary of' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object by indicating the specific set of words or terms that the subject is capable of recognizing, producing, or utilizing. This relationship highlights the extent or size of the vocabulary associated with the subject, often quantified in terms of the number of words or phrases included in that vocabulary.

Predicate-is_a_type_of.label: is a type of
Predicate-is_a_type_of.description: The predicate 'is a type of' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject belongs to a broader category represented by the object. It signifies that the subject is a specific instance or variation within the general classification denoted by the object, thereby providing a way to categorize and understand the subject in relation to other entities.

Predicate-experimental_tests_are_carried.label: experimental tests are carried out on
Predicate-experimental_tests_are_carried.description: The predicate 'experimental tests are carried out on' indicates that a systematic investigation or evaluation is being conducted regarding the object, which is typically a concept, method, or material, in relation to the subject. This implies that the subject is the focus of the testing process, and the results or findings from these tests are intended to provide insights, validate hypotheses, or assess performance related to the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is providing, showcasing, or introducing the object in a manner that conveys information, findings, or concepts related to the object. It implies a formal or structured delivery of content, often in a context where the subject aims to inform or educate the audience about the object.

Predicate-is_applied_in.label: is applied in
Predicate-is_applied_in.description: The predicate 'is applied in' indicates that the subject is utilized or implemented within the context of the object. It signifies a relationship where the subject serves a functional role or contributes to the processes, activities, or frameworks represented by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or example that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a larger set of concepts or entities, of which the subject is a part, thereby illustrating a generalization from the specific to the more inclusive.
